1111221211.content:
"Why not, huh? 'Bout time I lived my life! Stupid job..."

"Well, then, c'mon! I betcha they've got a photo room downstairs or something. Maybe we can mock up these fake i.d.s!"

Darcy withdrew from her bag two blank i.d.s, and Mary glanced over them with a little tension.

"Well...? Are you in or not?"
1111221211.title: Fake I.D.

11112212111.content:
"S-ssure."

"Well, follow me!"

Mary and Darcy bolted down the staircase, laughing and chuckling! Who cared anymore? They were pretty people, ready to party, and about to make some fake i.d.s! They looked the part, now they only had to make it legit!

Walking down a long corridor, Darcy skipped like a little kid in a candy store! She must really be enjoying herself, Mary thought. And why wouldn't she? Becoming sexy in a minute was an insanely cool feeling! Especially if you had looked like Darcy. Mary kinda felt jealous.

"Hey, look here!"

Sure enough, Darcy had found a room, sign reading...
11112212111.title: Rambunctious Actions

111122121111.content:
Mary nervously peered into the dark room; she was still taller than Darcy.

"Well, what's in there?"

"Kinda looks like school pictures all over again..."

"That'll be it!"

Both of the girls walked into the room, and Darcy flicked on the ligths. Instantly, bright incandescence flooded the room! Mary shielded her eyes, and slowly recovered her sight.

"Mary, look."

Darcy pointed at a stool, and Mary adjusted her eyes to see it clearly. And, clearly there, sat two i.d.s; one for Mary Longfield, and one for Darcy Daye. Mary noticed that the i.d. already had their "new" faces on them; could it be there was a picture in the photo booth as well? How were they printed so fast? And why weren't the others there?

"Could it be... We were supposed to recieve these in the first place?"

Darcy looked at Mary with a frightened countenance, and the two girls shook a bit. Nevertheless, they picked up their rightful i.d.s and headed out of the room!
111122121111.title: The Photo Room

Gary's neighbors was an older couple, and it was surprising they could even have a child, now 5 years old. Either way, he was still getting paid, and he needed the money. "Yeah, I'm not stupid. See ya." he responded.

"We'll see you in three days! Oh, and don't forget to feed the cat. She'll get really feisty if she doesn't eat." she called while walking out the door.

Happily splashing in the water, building sandcastles, and looking for treasure. As Greg slept, he didn’t notice the warmth growing in his diaper. It started out as a trickle at first, but gradually became a stream. The front of the diaper was getting soaked. Greg didn’t care. He was sleeping too soundly to feel it.

It seemed like Greg’s stream wasn’t slowing down soon. He didn’t need to pee before he started napping, but for some reason his body couldn’t stop now. He mumbled and shifted lazily in the crib as the warm dampness continued to spread, dying the thick diaper around his waist a pale yellow. He was wetting so much that the thick, puffy diaper couldn’t contain it, and soon, some of the urine started leaking out onto the mattress.

In his dream, he was sitting in a tide pool with Dillon; happily splashing around. He was wearing the cutest swim diaper and Dillon was wearing his big boy swim trunks with pictures of Spider-Man on them. The two of them just playing in the warmth. Suddenly Dillon looked at him, and suddenly kissed Greg on the lips. Greg loved it and kissed back. The boys were soon hugging and kissing each other deeply while laying in the small pool of water together. Greg felt something funny in his crotch. He rubbed it, sending more ripples of pleasure through his body. It started to feel hard, and was only getting stiffer with Dillon’s kissing and cuddling.

Dillon noticed Greg groping his crotch and giggled, “Here, let me do that.”, before he started rubbing Greg’s groin for him. “M-Mistah Dillon… P-Peepee hard…” Greg moaned, both in his dream and in his sleep. Dillon smiled, “It’s supposed too. Boys’ peepees get hard when they’re happy. Just keep touching it, it feels soooo good!” Dillon continued groping him while Greg sat there and softly moaned. He could feel some sort of pressure building up inside of him, something leaking out and making stickies in his swim diaper. “Mmmph…!! D-Dillon, peepee… C-Cumming!!” He gasped as he came into his diaper. In real life, Greg ejaculated suddenly and drew in a breath.

Dillon patting him on his shoulder, smiling warmly, had waked him up. “Wake up big guy, time for lunch!” Greg grinned. “Mistah Dillon!” As Dillon helped him out of the crib, he saw just how heavily used his diaper had been during his nap and giggled, “Looks like someone had an accident.” Greg blushed sheepishly as he suddenly became aware of his soggy diaper.

We were at Jakes, n’ Nevalan’ an’ we played an’ ‘den…” Greg babbled childishly about his dream to Dillon, who just smiled and nodded, “…An’ ‘den we were in a pool and it was soooo warm, an’ ‘den we kissed and cuddled an’ it felt weally good!!! ‘An’ ‘den I woke up.” Dillon chuckled as he changed him, “Sounds like you had a really good dream.” Greg nodded excitably.

After he was finished changing him, Dillon led Greg to the kitchen and sat his big, poofy butt down in a high chair, “Wait here, I’ll go get you something to eat!” Dillon grinned as he went over to the fridge. Greg kicked his legs and buzzed his lips in excitement. He was starving. Dillon opened the door and looked inside for some food for the both of them.

124.content:
Gary watched as the simpleton couple drove away, miles from caring. How stupid could they be? After all, they'd paid him up front, no questions, no worries. Did Gary really look that trustworthy? Or were they really as idiotic as he thought? He remembered hearing a story about people like that; they're the types that always end up getting jipped!

Assured that Mr. and Mrs. Numbnuts had left, Gary made a run for the front door. After all, with the key outside, Gary was hardly needed if he locked up. The kid could hold his own. Gary had, when Mom worked 'til ten and Dad wasn't around. And who cares about a goddamn cat, anyways? It would have died regardless. He jostled the doorknob, and then noticed something strange. The lock was only on the outside. Weird! And the dumbasses had locked up! Huh?

So, Gary headed towards the backyard. That door, too, was outside lock only, and, oh, locked! Gary couldn't believe it. Wow! Seems the family was a little more keen that he'd thought! Gary rushed around, checking the windows. He then remembered another of the family's instructions...

"The only window that opens is Dillion's; it was replaced. The others have been jammed up since we moved!"

With a grin, Gary hopped up the stairs, and barged into the tot's room. Child's play, to say the least. He opened the frame, just large enough to slip through. God, from the second story... He felt like Spiderman! How ironic...

Just as Gary was about to leap out of the window, a noise caught him by surprise! It was...
124.title: When One Door Closes, You Go Out the Back!

choices: Does Gary call the police and run away, hopefully with Dillon?
Does Gary stay and wait out the assailants?
12433.content:
Gary spun around after hearing that glass-shattering noise! Followed quite quickly by the cat pitching an awful fit, and the kid crying! Oh shit, what was going on?!

Gary bolted down those stairs faster than he'd ever run in life. As he passed through the kitchen, his hand slipped over an out of place knife. Voices could be heard from the other room, where the break in had occurred. Damn! He was lucky he'd still been there. Seems as though the family's leave had become too convenient, for both robber and lazy babysitter.

He peeked into the next room, just to see what was happening. It looked like Dillon wasn't in that room, and he couldn't see the cat...

Quickly, he darted back behind the counter as he saw a pair of eyes staring back! Praying he had a few more seconds, Gary clutched the knife a little tighter. Oh God, why did it have to be today?

Gary took a deep breath.

Gary knew that drawing the attention away from where Dillon was could possibly save the kid. Then they could both climb out that open window to safety. Just how could they do it?

Gary noticed on the floor a decorative rock collection on the shelf behind him. Too easy, perhaps? He clutched a nice sized piece of rock, and prepared to chuck it out one of the windows. After all, what's more alarming to a thief than somebody else breaking into the same house? He made his way into a second story room farthest away from the first floor room where Dillon sat. Eyeing a nice big window, Gary thought this would be child's play. Gary took the deepest breath of his life, and hurled the rock right out the glass window. The sound broke the silence deafeningly! He knew the robbers would hear that, but would they follow it as he had planned?

Gary could hear the stirring of the robbers, and a whole lot of running, but where were they headed?
12433112.title: Kill Two Birds with One Stone... Out a Window

But apparently the robbers had outsmarted him, and figured the rock had to come from the inside, not the out. So, up the stairs they had run, and Gary gasped in fear. They cracked in the door...
124331122.title: The Babysitter's Dead... Or Gonna Be.

1243311221.content:
Gary heard them in the next room over, and covertly escaped the second floor. Once back on the first, he could still hear them up above, clammoring around. They tried desperately to find him, but now they wouldn't... Hopefully.

Dillon sat there, still whimpering. Gary untied him, and once silent again, the two made a break for the nearest exit... Gary then remembered the strange thing about the house.

"All of the doors lock from the outside. And are locked."

Crap! Now what?

It was then Dillon pointed out a seam in the floor. Gary leaned close to it. It wasn't merely a seam, it was a trapdoor! Gary smiled to himself, and Dillon almost clapped. But, then the two quickly shimmied into the hole, and Gary took a last look around. Hopefully the cat was alright... He heard the robbers again, hobbling back down the stairs; time to go!

Dillon and Gary made their way through the tunnel, and came out in the elderly neighbor's lawn. In fact, that same neighbor happened to spray them down with water! They explained their story quickly, and the neighbor turned up their hearing aid. Of course they hadn't noticed before! So, now all that waited was for them to stay safe until the police arrived... Which they did, within the next five minutes.

The robbers didn't have the smarts to leave once their two hostages had, so of course the police caught them right as they went back out the window. Dillon's parents were phoned, and returned from their trip a little early. They thanked Gary for saving the kid, and Gary managed to make a few more bucks off it. He knew he'd done the right thing...
1243311221.title: Ending the Job...

12433112211.content:
Gary hadn't heard from the Ramseys (Dillon's family) since the incident. It had been almost a week now, and Gary had returned to his old ways. For that, it came to no surprise that Gary was fired from his job at the movieplex, and cut classes to the point where most people didn't know his name. Alas, it was same old, same old...

When he got home, he found a note left by his mother...

"Gary,

It's been a really hard time on your mother. I've gone up to Florida to relax for a while. Please keep up the house while I'm gone for the next month or so.

P.S. It's not your fault."

Great! His own mother had left him, too. The woman couldn't stay in one state for more than a week or two. Then again, she hadn't really taken any time to herself since Dad left...

One look at the house erased Gary's notions of sympathy. How could she just leave the house to him? It hadn't been a week since the last time he'd watched a house, and look where that ended up! Gary sighed, and planted himself on the couch. It was too much work! Just as he hit the power button, the phone rang. He disregarded it. Probably a wrong number. After a few more minutes, the phone rang again! What was this? Finally, the phone chimed a third time, and Gary meandered over towards it. He picked up the receiver.

"Hello?"

"Oh, hello, is this Gary, Gary Tahel?"

"Um, yes..."

"Hello, Gary! We just can't thank you enough for that last time!"

It was none other than the Ramseys. He groaned to himself. Why were they calling about this now?

"We were wondering, Gary, if we could call on you again for something?"

Huh? They wanted him to do another job? Not gonna happen! He had one house to take care of, that was enough!

"You see, we're going out of town. We just need someone to watch Dillon and the cat while we're gone. The house is fine, we installed a new security system after you left."

"Did you fix the problem with the doors?"

"What?"

"Oh, never mind... I'm sorry, Mrs. Ramsey, I can't really do that right now. You see, I'm watching my own house..."

"Really? Where do you live? We could drop off Dillon and the cat at your house!"

"W-wait---!"

"Hold on, I just remembered, we have your address! Be right there!"

She hung up, and Gary was left speechless. Now what?
12433112211.title: Beginning The Next

1243311222.content:
Gary barely had time to say a prayer before they found him...

YOU DIE.
1243311222.title: Goodbye, Gary!

124332.content:
Despite his better judgement, Gary decided he was going to scare off the assailants. After all, he was the one left in charge of the house, and paid! His former thoughts of leaving now dissolved, as he only focused on saving that kid... This house made him feel stronger, braver. So, without his former cowardice, Gary tried to think of a plan to save the family... It was then Gary ran into the cat.

Now, Gary had expected a little cat, just like any other family's. Instead, he found a wild animal, that only minutely resembled its docile counterpart. The cat was colored in bold orange and red, similar to a tiger's coat. Gary looked him straight in the eyes wide and gold, and knew he wasn't dealing with any old housecat.

"Human. Get yourself and the young master out of here. Now."

Was the cat talking to him?! Gary swore he was going insane. But, the cat let out a low growl.

"Go, now! I will deal with them. You have to save the child. So go!"

The cat pushed him aside. Gary staggered, and...
124332.title: A Zero-Hero

1243321.content:
"I'm staying right here! I was told to protect the house!"

Gary lacked notice that he was on all fours talking to a cat. He didn't care.

"Alright, if you say so, human. But let me first entrust you with something special."

The cat's golden eyes peered straight into his again, and Gary felt a certain heat behind them. That heat spread through him, too, and suddenly Gary found himself wrapped in this burning sensation! All at once it went away, and Gary now found a strange cats-eye necklace dangling from his neck.

"I've given you a special power, Gary. When the moment arises, you will be able to use it as you will. Be careful."

With that, the cat disappeared up the stairs, probably to save Dillon. Gary grinned, and wondered what kind of power the cat had given him... Hold on, the cat? What kind of power could a cat give? He thought he was just dreaming, but holding that cats-eye necklace, which was solid, made him ponder. What was going to happen?

The robbers decided that for him, and showed up! Gary crawled back into a defensive position, and the necklace began to glow...
1243321.title: The Valor of a Lion

124332111.content:
Gary started to growl, which revealed his teeth. His human teeth became sharper and sharper, until they could not be called human teeth anymore. Gary lets out a large Lion roar, which scares the robbers.

"What the hell is going on here?"

As Gary walks on all fours towards his foes, he does not notice the yellow fur emerging all over his body, nor does he feel his hair transforming into a Lion's mane. A lion tail pushes out from his butt, and his face pushes out into a snout. Before long, the once human Gary is now a full fledged Lion. Gary lets out another Roar, which causes the robbers to run the way they came. Gary lets out one more roar, this time in victory.
124332111.title: A Lion

1243321111.content:
Gary (still in lion form) awkwardly wandered on his new paws. Sure, he could scare away a robber, but walk like a lion? He could not. Something in him instinctually told him to seek out that cat, the tiger-like one. Only after that cat stared at him did this happen... Was he asleep and dreaming, however? That could be. But Gary's hot breath brushed aside the hair on his front paws, a sensation that no one can ignore. He'd have to find that cat...

Lucky enough, there the creature stood at the foot of the steps. But now Gary swore he could see the cat as... a tiger. A big orange one, too. The two large felines examined each other's form, and then sat across from each other, eyes deeply glaring into each other.

So, it worked. You're now one of my kind, as I am one of yours.

Gary's nose twitches expressively, and the cat senses his confusion. In respect, he lowers his head.

Your bravery and loyalty to the Masters family in watching over Dillon is much appreciated. I could not be more indebted to you.

Then how come I'm like this?! Pretty crappy repayment!

Gary's sudden snarl frightens the tiger-cat. He gives a quick one back, and circles Gary.

If you don't value my gift, I have no qualms in taking it back. But if you simply don't understand it, I can explain everything to you.

"My name is Foster," the cat says. "You have been given a very powerful gift: The power to transform into any feline. There are rules about this however:

1. You may transform into a human but you will have cat instincts
2. If you stay too long as a cat you will stay that way forever
3. The way to use this power is to think of the feline that you want to be and transform and think of yourself if you want to go back,"

Gary thought about what he looked like and transformed back into his normal self. He was still sitting like a cat but found it comfortable so he did not bother to move.

"Oh and also you keep a tail in human form," said Foster

Gary looked behind him and saw a house cat tail waving back and fourth across the floor. However he did not seem to be mad even though he thought he should.

12433211221.content:
Gary gasped feeling fire burning through his veins. Clutching the token in his hand he curled up soon falling to the ground with a thump. He felt hot and itchy all over, like thousands of bugs where crawling under his skins. w-what did that cat give me... he thought to himself. Dimly he could hear the robbers coming closer but he was more concerned with the sudden tightness in his clothes. He panted lookin over him self groaning as he sees rips and tears appear in his clothes, underneath his skin taking on a rather red bumpy look. He shifted around hearing one of the robbers suddenly let out a loud curse, slamming the kitchen door shut, and somehow hearing their cursing despite the kitchen door being solid oak.

Gary was more concerned on how his hands had taken on a beastly look, the fingertips growing into thick claws scoring deep gauges into the kitchen floor. His pinky and ring finger fusing together leaving him with 4 large long digits on a rather big paw. Gary gasped again studying his new paws as he felt his nose pull forward into a snout and his clothes finally rip unable to take the stress, revealing his new scale covered muscular body. Stumbling around the kitchen creating untold damage, he attempted to look over himself as the changes kept coming faster, two wings sprouting from his back and practically punctuating themselves on the ceiling before folding and settling themselves on his back. A tail grew from his behind quickly reaching over four feet in length, whipping around wildly, causing some kitchen appliances to crash to the floor before settling down behind him swaying softly as Gary finds his new equilibrium on all fours.

Soon a tall slender adolescent dragon was laying in the kitchen instead of a sixteen year old boy. Red scales gleaming on his hide, shimmering with every single gulp of breath he took. A red fin was on his head leading down to a spikey spine going down his neck, back and ending as tiny nubs on the end of his tail. His wings were curled tightly into his side, unable to stretch out into the tight confines of the kitchen. Gary licked around in his mouth feeling the now predator like canines and needle sharp teeth that now filled his mouth. He then noticed to his surprise that his tongue was now forked. With shock and a bit of amusement he flicked his tongue out tasting the air, mostly tasting his own sweat, the cat, and the robbers... THE ROBBERS.

Gary gave a sudden start, remembering the thieves that were just beyond the oak door. He scrambled to his feet creating some more scratches within the floor as he heard the robbers end their argument, the sound of a gun's safety coming off sounding like a death toll to his new ears. Gary gave a soft whimper feeling as if his heart was going to hammer straight up his throat and that his chest was heated up almost boiling him.. Infact his chest felt like it was burning up, fire starting deep in under his diaphragm and working its way up his esophagus.

He gave a loud groan which soon built into a roar, fire streaming out of his mouth and to the door that was just beginning to open, blasting it closed and making the robbers on the other side yell in fear, scrambling to get away from the door which grew super heated and charred. Taking a deep breath the fire stream suddenly dribbling from his mouth, smoke streaming from his nostrils, Gary gazes in amazement at the destruction he caused, the door practically ash now, falling off the hinges that was dripping off the door-frame, crackling and smoking. Beyond he could see the two robbers whom where unconscious and beyond them poor Dillion tied to a chair and looking at Gary in a mix of wonder and fear.

Now Gary...

"Here I am sweetie," came Cindy's voice a few moments later. "You are coming along just fine, Sophie says we'll both be ready to go soon."

"By the way," Rachel commented, wondering why her own voice sounded somewhat foreign to her,"you never mentioned what my job is?"

"Well, if you must know, today the ladies group needs a couple extra for bridge so you and I are joining in."

135122122121.content:
Jason got to the place and found himself escorted down various hallways.

"I'm looking forward to seeing Rachael, though it still seems like a bit of a joke. I mean really, who ever heard of a person suddenly being turned old?"

"Oh, I don't know, strange things happen all the time," replied the intern.

As they made their way down various hallways, Jason found himself feeling weird. He could have sworn his pants fit better this morning, and his body felt worn down.

Rounding a corner, Jason could have sworn he saw a woman and man get younger as they passed the beauty salon.

"Did they just get younger, young lady?" and why did I just call her young lady? Where did the beard come from?"

"Yes they did, just like the changes happening to you."

"Ah don feel any youngah," Jason answered, and noted he didn't sound it either.

"That's because you are getting older instead," she giggled.

"Olduh, did you say olduh? Why, ah don think ah quite agree wid dat."

"At least this way, you and Rachael will have more in common."

They entered the recreation room, and Jason noticed his beard was long and had gone mostly white, as the intern handed him a cane and helped him to a seat next to an old woman.

"Rachael, that you?"

"Jason hon, that you?"

"I'll just leave you two alone to get reacquainted, the intern laughed, as she got Mary and they headed elsewhere.

"How'd ah geet so durn old, eh?"

"Ah been askin maself the same thing hon-ney, sure nough. Wanna go play some bingo?"

"I can't believe you have twelve children!" Mary exclaimed. "It must have been so hard on your poor body. I mean, you do look great, ma'am, but having so many babies must leave its mark."

Rachel felt sick, but the memories took hold. She remembered years and years of just having babies, one after the other. And while it was hard, she remembered with some fondness how huge her belly would be while she held another child in her arms. She remembered days spent giving birth with no time to rest before she had to return home. And the midnight feedings, the late nights helping with homework, all the sewing...

Her body changed more.

Her belly softened into a proper little pooch of loose skin, distorted not just from age but from years of holding big babies. Her poor breasts grew out, but shriveled under the memory milk and little greedy mouths.

Her face was also transformed, with harsh lines growing in from the pure stress of raising babies.

"I-I guess I do have a large family," poor Rachel admitted. "We...I think I just didn't know..."

"About birth control? My, you really didn't."

1352.content:
"Oh, I meant to tell you, we have an appointment at the salon we have here."

"We do? Well, what is the appointment for? I just got my hair done yesterday and got new makeup as well."

"Yes, we do," Cindy replied with a grin , as she lead Rachel into the state of the art salon, and showed her to a cushy chair.

"What I need you to do is fill out a form with some info., so we can make some adjustments to you."

"What sort of adjustments do you mean? I'm okay for the job, aren't I?"

"You are just fine, except for a few things that we can easily take care of. While I'm in the process of getting that taken care of,

just make yourself comfortable in the chair and fill out this little form for me on the computer in front of you. When you are done with it,

just hit submit and I'll be back for you pronto."

With that, Cindy took off and left Rachel there filling out some online forms.

"What do you see yourself like when you get older? Traditional old age, styling and dressing like someone younger, or a little of both?"

"Hmmmm, a little of both," she remarked.

"If you could be any age over 35 right now, would you be 45, 55, or 70?"

"Oh, I think 70 might be fun. These are some strange questions."

"Next one, how do you feel about being younger than you are now?" "Sounds fun, for a little while I suppose."

"Do you see yourself fitting in now and in the future, or do you see yourself as an individual no matter what your age?"

"I've always been very much myself."

"If you needed to, would you wear glasses or contacts?"

"I'm okay with glasses."

"Have you ever heard of ar or ap, and are you averse to either?"

"I'm pretty open to lot's of things I guess, though I'm not sure exactly what those things are."

"How do you feel about your body going through rapid or gradual changes, ie. within minutes or in the course of an hour?"

"I like to just get things done with, though I have been known to savor things now and again."

" If you knew you were about to be transformed, would you want to watch the process or be surprised by it?"

"I'd love to watch the whole process as it occurred."

"Are you flexible and accepting of change, or do you fight it tooth and nail?"

"I accept whatever comes and go with the flow."

"How do you feel about sharing your energy with others?"

"I like to help out where I can."

At this point, Rachel came upon the submit button and pressed it.

He handed her a mirror and she noted that her hair had started going gray. As she passed her mid forties, her face had developed laugh lines and crow's feet."

"How old will I get young man, and could you change the heat--it is soooo hot," she gasped, as she fanned herself.

uncomfortable. Her long, curly, black hair now had a salt and pepper look to it, and she had a white streak down one side of her face.

152.content:
Kevin owned a business what took old as unused houses and building much larger, and he with his worker tore down the structures to allow new use of the valued land.

One warm and story day a woman dressed in black arrived at his office, she slapping down a contract, wanting the Hayworth castle torn down, leveled, the wood burned, the riches found carted away and sold as scrap. When asked what the woman wanted as payment for the sale of the reusable scrap, she stated, "Nothing, just rid the world of that terrible place!"

Kevin knew of the Hayworth castle, it a large red sandstone building, three stories tall, and several thousand square feet built into each floor. It would hold a wealth of rich rare metals used to build it, as well marble slabs for steps and some interior walls. He signed the contract of promise to raze the building to the ground level and back fill then the basement with sand and topsoil to remove any reminder the building had ever stood on the land.

As the woman dressed n black turned and was walking out his office, Kevin thought he noticed something of her dress dragging along the floor. He being a gentleman, rushed to take hold of it and then tell the kind woman as to her dress was touching the floor. What he touched made the woman turn quickly and stop walking, she stood looking down at Kevin, as he kneeling was looking up at her.

"Do not try to disgrace me by touching me in an improper way!" The woman said in a demanding tone of voice.

"Sorry," Kevin said to her, "I saw something dragging across the floor, a hem of your dress perhaps, it might have caught in a closing door and caused you to trip and fall, I would not wish that no matter what!"

"Mind you own self," the woman replied, as she hoisted higher her dress an inch or two as turned and walked out the office, as this time and from where Kevin had knelt what he saw then better was a hairy switch, as found or part of, being the end to an animal tail.

"Excuse me, but you have a tail!" Kevin said, he seeing, knowing what he saw, and she having demeaned him, rich contract or no, he would call a spade a spade.

The woman dressed in black stopped walking, she turned quickly as if on one heel of her shoe to face toward Kevin. "So, I have a tail, if that is not an insult than nothing more need be said about you working at the castle, I decide the contract is null and void."

Kevin stood up, he turned to his desk and picked up the contract he had just signed, but then ruined the mutual trust, and was about to hand it back to the woman when he saw what was dragging on the floor swish to one side as if it had the ability to move of its own accord. Seeing this oddity, Kevin knelt and reaching for the odd item, the woman bade said for him to stop, not touch, or she would..."

Taking a handhold of the then realized hairy switch, Kevin slipped his hand along the attached bony structure of the warm as living appendage, his hand following up as under her long dress to where he touched her flat muscular behind.

"I believe this was your tail dragging across the floor, cute, a woman with a cow tail, should make for some interesting conversation." Kevin said, this time with a smile as if the woman were a weirdo.

Suddenly her eyes blazed a wild eyed stare at Kevin. He saw her eyes being bright yellow, glaring at him from under her black broad rimmed hat and the netting she had covering her face.

"Bold you are, too bold to remain a man, bold enough to walk a pasture, bold too of worth to be the herd sire, then such should be that you, become beginning now then a bull worthy of his salt from being diligent to his herd, then farm owner, and feeling demeaned, different from what he was born!" She said, she laying her curse upon Kevin, wishing to doom as damn him for his insolent attitude.
152.title: Kevin Grantia (32)

153.content:
Victoria sighed as she looked up at the old house. It now read "Grant's Home for Boys and Girls", an orphanage. She trod up the familiar steps, a little teary-eyed. Once, long ago, this had been her home, too. Where her younger brothers had grown up, and then left forever. Where, oh so long ago, she had been like these young children, alone, without family.

Victoria looked far beyond her 51 years of age. Most of her friends joked around with her, calling her the "Old Granny" of the group. She lacked the confidence and happiness to keep her youth with her, and she felt extremely embarassed to be asking for a job involving children. They'd probably just torment her, too.

But being around children made her feel young again, too. It was the reason she'd worked so hard in the school system. But now, retired from teaching, she just wanted to be among those she loved to see everyday.

Victoria rung the bell, and as a surprise, Mr. Grant himself answered the door.

Mr. Herman Grant was the nephew of one of Victoria's oldest friends, and through such friend did she find out about this job. He was youthful, too, perhaps not even 30 yet, but he struck everyone he met as the most eccentric person possible. Because of his humor and good nature, the kids stuck to him like glue.

Grant welcomed in Victoria, and already she felt happier.

"The children are all in the back yard right now, so I thought it might be a good time to explain the job."

"Okay," Victoria said.

They walked into the kitchen, and sat down across from each other. With a very serious face on the otherwise jolly man, Victoria knew to take him seriously.

"I've been trying to get this one kid to settle down and play with the others, y'see. The kid won't listen to me, or any of the others. So I heard that you used to work with students like that, and I thought, 'Huh, well I'll get her to work for me!' And so, I'm hoping that maybe you can relate to the kid, help 'em out, make 'em happy, y'know? And about the pay... It comes at the end of every week, and it's about $50 an hour. Sound good?"

$50 an hour? This Grant might really be crazy, to pay that much for such a simple job. But Victoria wasn't going to complain, she was very excited now.

"Who is this child? Can I meet them?"

"Oh, sure! His/her name is..."
153.title: Young At Heart

choices: Claire came running back through the house.
1531.content:
Claire DeMont."

When Grant finishes, an deafening screech emits from the top of the stairs. Victoria watches as a young girl, no more than four, is being dragged by her ponytail down the steps by a rather frail looking child. The frail child has the genuine look of a bully, and is pushing and bruishing on the little girl. Grant runs up to catch them, and the bully punches him in the leg. Grant recoils in pain, and the bully laughs and runs away. The poor little girl is left sobbing on the steps as Grant limps his way back towards Victoria.

"I'm going to assume that's Claire?"

Victoria motions towards the door the bully exited from. Grant nodded.

Victoria sighed, and made her way towards the door, but before she left...

"That's for telling on me Alicia!" she screamed as the girl fell backwards.

Victoria knelt down and hugged the little Alicia to her as Grant grabbed Claire. She tried to kick him, but he held her arms above her head.

'It's lock up for you young lady!" he snarled, trying to sound menacing. Claire just yawned.

"You know that I don't care, right old man" she sneered.

Grant dragged her out of the room. The two women heard him go to Claire's room, heard something shut and a key turn in a lock.

Victoria held Alicia. She was crying and holding her face. A large hand shaped bruise was forming on her cheek. She clung to Victoria like she was her mother. Victoria felt a sudden rush of sympathy for the girl. She knew that she would not rest well until either somebody taught Claire a lesson or she was out of the orphanage.

Grant came back. He was mopping sweat off his brow.

"She's quite the case," he said, gesturing to Claire's room where the little terror was trying to bash the door down, "Here Alicia. I'll get you a nice cup of hot chocolate."

When he returned, he spoke to Victoria.

"We've tried everything. We've locked her in her room, we've spanked her, we even made her look after Alicia for a day! Nothing has worked though."

I would just want you to teach Claire a lesson. Alicia is terrified of that girl, ever since she told me that it was Claire that stole Jimmy's rabbit. Claire beats her up almost daily."

153122.content:
"You are regressing to be Alicia's big sister." Grant said finally with some heavy reserve.

Victoria was clueless, "I'm a little too menopausal to be anyone's big sister Herman."

"I can fix that Victoria," Grant offered, "I can make you young again."

"That's ridiculous. What kind of hogwash are you spewing?" Victoria snubbed.

"It's not hogwash...I have......powers." Grant said.

Victoria sighed, "I'm beginning to lose my patience here. Why do you need me here if you can just fix everything with a magic wand?"

"It's not that simple," Grant said before asking, "You grew up here right Victoria? You were a little girl in these halls just like Alicia and Claire no so long ago?"

Victoria answered, "And I was kicked out as a teen long before you were born young man."

"I know Victoria but in the span of things we're all relatively short lived." Grant explained, "But I can play with timelines. In a way I can merge the past or future with the present, intermingling realities into a single concise whole."

"Like a reverse time traveler?" Victoria asked curious despite herself.

Grant nodded, "Sort of, I like to think of myself as a guide to help others find themselves. With my aunt's guidance I came to this orphanage with the intent to turn these poor kids into happy adults. If no one wants to adopt a kid anymore, why not just boost them into adulthood?"

Victoria remembered the times she wished for something similar when she was growing up in the orphanage. She was practically a mother to her younger brothers growing up and she often dreamed she would suddenly transform into an sexy independent woman and raise her own brothers as adorable sons. That would have been a good life.

"Why haven't you?" Victoria asked, "I'm sure a bully like Claire would love you for that."

Grant grimaced, "Because she doesn't have a future. None of them really do. Not a reality that should be merged with a young child."

"So the offer for me to come here...." Victoria was beginning to understand.

"I need to bring some good back into the orphanage, If I can pull some of the past into the present I can weave the timelines and hopefully influence a brighter future for the kids here."

"And then you'll grow them into adults." Victoria stated.

"If they want to." Grant said. "And that goes for you too. I can't really pay you $50 an hour."

"What?' I'm here for a job Herman. I expect payment!" she yelled.

"And what better payment is there than getting your youth back? You help me with Alicia and Claire and you get to be young all over again. But you'll be a child Victoria, I'll have to allocate resources to feed and care for you just like the others. I'm on a low budget as it is." Granted stressed.

In her heart Victoria wanted to be a kid again, it was embarrassing to admit but she took Grant's fantasy as gospel.

"To be a girl again.....It would be something else for me." Victoria said.

"You should be sure about this. You'll keep your consciousness and your memories but lose everything else to your past self. Education, emotions, maturity, all of it will revert to that you had as a child."

"I was an obedient little bookworm. I'll be a good girl for you." Victoria smiled.

"And to Claire and Alicia hopefully." Grant said as his hands flashed into a complex web of light flashed into Victoria.

In a moment she felt herself getting smaller, no getting younger. Her sagging breasts, perked up before then retreating body back into her chest. Her greying hair gained color and grew into a shoulder length cut. She finally lost her womanly curves as she firmly reentered her prepubescence. Adulthood, even adolescence was now many years away.

How old was Victoria becoming?

"Mr. Hanson?"

The youthful clerk with a Southern accent called out the name with dismay. Around the world, he was famous for the highest catches. Joseph Hanson, the Devil's Huntsman, they called him. Not a soul could lay a hand on his record. And now, he was finally applying for retirement, on the social front.

J.D. Hanson crocked his head properly upon his head again, and shifted his eyes around as if he was John Wayne. He walked up to the youthful clerk, who'd just peed his pants seeing the man himself.

"Son, you might wanna watch that, next time you're calling up for interviews."

With that, Hanson shook the terrified clerk's hand, and slipped into the next room.

There, waiting at the table, sat the Mystery Man. A collector Hanson had been familiar with in the world of animal bounty. If there was a price on it, you could bet the Mystery Man had a req out on it.
(req is slang for request in this story.) Hanson hadn't wanted to fool around with this shady guy, but after the terrible outcome of his last hunt, he had no choice. The Mystery Man offered him a price that no man could ignore in Hanson's position.

"Mr. Hanson, so nice to finally see you."

The Mystery Man's voice was distorted, but J.D. knew he'd met the man in the flesh.

"I was sure you wouldn't refuse the offer. The price is high enough for even the Huntsmaster himself..."

With that, the Mystery Man laid out a briefcase. Business type...

"Inside that briefcase is every batch of info you could ever want about your prey. Common locations, last sightings, etc. Plus, a couple hundred to get you around. Couldn't leave that all up to you, could I?"

The Mystery Man laughed devilishly. Hanson himself feared the Man might be ol' Red himself, come to snatch his title back from the elderly J.D.

"Your mission begins in 24, if you can handle it."

Hanson glared at the Mystery Man. Of course he did. They shook on it, and Hanson made his exit.

"Oh, and one more thing... I'm sure you remember you're chasing...

Gina walked into the casting studio and started reading for various parts as instructed.

It seemed as she looked around that most of the people there were about her age of 24 or a bit younger.

She didn't really pay much attention to the script, that was what her agent was for. She was there to read and act the part,

whatever that part might be and take direction.

After a day of this, she felt relieved when the director came up and told her,"I believe we have a major part for you, though it means

you'll have to go through some changes from time to time. How do you feel about aging?"

"You mean old age makeup?" she sighed absently.

"Yeah, something like that," the director replied.

"The script starts out with you in the present, and then there is a secret smoke bomb dropped into your party that causes you and everyone there to age. Then it is a race to

figure out what is causing everyone to age and reverse the effects. Some of you will age faster and others more slowly."

"I don't really care for a lot of time in makeup though," she replied hesitantly. What was her agent roping her into this time.

"Not a problem, as we have a new process for this, you won't really notice a thing and you'll find it really easy to get into character."

"Well, then I guess count me in," she told him.

"Great," the director replied, be here tomorrow at 6 am.

She spent about the next week filming scenes as she was currently, and then the director

came to her trailer one afternoon when they finished and handed her a bottle of juice.

"Drink this tonight when you get back to your hotel room," he let her know.

"What is it?" she asked.

"It is something that'll make it easier for you in the upcoming scenes, and it is perfectly healthy."

"Probably means it tastes terrible," she thought, though this was turning out to be a fun job, so why not.

"If you insist Phil," she replied, and then headed to the limo and off the lot.

"We'll send someone to get you about 8 am," Phil told her," just remember to drink the whole thing.

"Does it go well with tequila?"

"Sure...I guess, just don't overdo it tonight."

At which point she headed off the lot back to her room. She poured the contents of the purple liquid into a glass and added some tequila,

and fell down on the couch and put her feet up. The stuff wasn't half bad, and she figured it might have been okay even without the alcohol.

Her boyfriend came over to take her to dinner, and she finished the drink and headed out with him.

The group was soon drinking and chatting amiably.

"So, what is it you two gentlemen do for a living?" Gina asked.

"Yeah, we are on the verge of a big breakthrough too," Hank replied, unable to contain himself.

"Do tell, " smiled Sandy, as she casually caressed Hank's hand.

"We really shouldn't say anything too much," Charles told them cautiously.

"Oh alright," Charles said in a hushed tone. "We have come up with a way to reverse the aging process."

"Really?" the two ladies replied in unison.

"Absolutely," Hank responded. "We have been testing it for about the last year and a half, and we think we can finally control the results."

"How so?" Sandy asked, more curious by the second.

"The initial batches of the potion we came up with actually did the opposite of what we intended," Charles informed them," and made people age instead.

Now, for the most part, only the person taking the stuff gets younger and by a specific amount of years."

"That is excellent," Gina replied, and then thinking this too coincidental added," so what happened to the test subjects?"

"Oh they are still around," Hank told them."They are for the most part back to normal, though maybe a few years older or younger than they were initially."

1552.content: Where is Robert's new job?
1552.title: Robert Traxman (18)

15521.content:
Coming straight out of high school, Robert Traxman was hoping to get a good job before college. He knew that he had summer break and all that, but he wanted to get some good job experience before hitting the books again the very next semester. It was with this in mind that he began job searching. However, many places were full, and he was unable to get many offers.

However, as he was looking around the internet, he found a Help Wanted to help around the Johnson Farm just outside of town. It wasn't that far away from his house, and it seemed to pay well as well. His family seemed to agree with the idea, although his younger sister found the idea of him working on a farm to be pretty funny, something that even he laughed a bit at.

So, the very next day, he was driving off to the Johnson Farm, making the 1 hour trip out there. The road got a bit rocky as he got closer, and soon enough, he found a tiny parking lot there, but he imagined meant that they didn't usually have large crowds here for whatever reason. Anyway, he parked his car where he figured was a good spot to stop and got out of the car.

He walked up to the house nearby, knocking on the door gently. As he waited, he looked down at his attire. A simple red t-shirt, some jeans, and his work shoes. The ad said to dress casually, given the work on the farm, so he took that to heart. Soon enough, an older man opened the door, smiling at Robert.

"Hello son, I'm Ken Johnson. Come on in." he smiled. He welcomed Robert in, showing Robert a bit of the inside of the house. He talked a bit about the job, saying that he was glad that someone took up the offer.

"So you think you can do it?" he asked.

"Of course sir." said Robert.

"Good. Glad to hear it." said Robert before taking something out of his pocket. "I'm going out for a while now, so I'll need you to take care of things. There are instructions about how to do things, and it's pretty easy. This here is a little something as a thanks from me. No, go on and take it. I don't take no for an answer."

The thing was a tiny necklace, not really special in any way, but Robert imagined that it might not be a bad idea, so he took the necklace with a smile, thanking the man. After that, Ken excused himself to go do some errands. He didn't say when he would come back, so Robert was apparently alone for now. Absentmindedly, he clasped the tiny necklace around his neck. Right as it happened, he felt a tiny surge go through him.

"What was that?" he asked, looking around. "Oh well, guess it was just the wind."

If only he knew.
15521.title: A Farm

choices: Robert continued to watch Bessie the cow
Robert leaves Bessie for now, and continues to see the farm
155211.content:
Robert took a quick look around the house. It was a pretty rustic, old looking farm house, the types you would see in those old movies about farmers trying to save their land. Robert kind of liked it. He lived in the city for all of his life, and he never really got out to the country much. He started to think about how he wouldn't mind staying out here in his future. He didn't really have anything planned out. Maybe, eventually, a nice, long stay in the country might do him some good.

Robert quickly realized that, while the house was interested, what he really wanted to check out at the moment was the backyard, the actual farm itself. Robert found his way through that house, and to the back door, which lead right out to the actual farm. Robert let out a bit of a gasp.

The farm was pretty huge, even surpassing Robert's wildest imagination. It seemed like there were miles and miles of field, of grass, of crops. There was a large, red barn pretty close to the house, and many different pens full of various animals. Pigs, Sheep, Chickens, every single animal you could think of being on a farm, was on this farm. Even in the distance, Robert saw a bunch of cows grazing.

But then he noticed something a bit odd. One of the cows was very far away from the pack. In fact, one of the cows was grazing right next to the house. This struck Robert as a little odd. So he decided to walk out and say hello to this strange cow.

Robert only had to take a couple of steps before reaching this cow, who was still grazing on the grass around the house. Robert stood right next to this cow and started petting her head.

"Hello there, girl. What are you doing out here?" Robert said with a laugh.

The cow looked up, straight into Robert's eyes. Robert stared back. He was so entranced by this, that he didn't notice his necklace was starting to glow. Nor did he realize that the cowbell about this cow's neck also started to glow.

As both of the glows died down, the cow mooed at Robert, and went back to grazing.

That's when Robert noticed the cowbell clanging around this cow's neck. Robert noticed there was an engraving on it, and took a closer look.

"Bessie, huh? I guess that's your name. Well, Bessie. My name is Robert. I guess I'll be around to take care of you." Robert said

Bessie looked up and mooed again.

1552112.content:
Well, as far as Robert could see, Bessie was just fine for now. He surely didn't need to watch her 24/7. Besides, she was just one of the many animals there. It was with that in mind that Robert waved a bit to Bessie and began to leave.

"Bessie. Kind of a typical name." laughed Robert to himself. He shouldn't have been surprised though.

Anyway, he looked at a lot of the other animals, which all seemed to be behaving normally. It was a good indicator of how Mr. Johnson ran the place, with it being so well organized even when he was away. The chickens ran back and forth in their little pen, while the pigs just laid out in the sun. It all seemed pretty peaceful.

"Well, from what I read, he already fed them today. Maybe I should take a look around the fields." he said to himself.

As he observed, the fields looked like they could go on for miles and miles, leaving plenty of room for the animals to graze and whatnot. Robert decided to take a short walk through the fields, choosing to get a good grasp of the farmland, especially since he was going to be working here and all. He wondered if he should tell his parents or his sister about this. She loved animals, after all. He made a mental note to call Sarah about it.

That aside, he walked through the fields until he was a good distance from where all the cows and others were grazing, and just admired how the small hills and green grass made for quite the scenery.

"Those cows are lucky, having this much room to run around, even though they don't really run." he chuckled to himself. After a while, he was beginning to think that it might be time to head back, perhaps explore the house a bit more. However, as he did so, he could feel his stomach growling. Apparently, it was close to noon, and he was starting to get pretty hungry. However, this hunger felt a bit unusual, as if he was even hungrier than normal.

"Woah, how much room do I have in there to feel this hungry?" he said to himself.
1552112.title: Robert leaves Bessie for now, and continues to ...

choices: Robert walks into the house, but can't find something he wants to eat
Before he walks inside, Something else outside catches Robert's eye.
15521121.content:
Robert slightly quickened his pace as he walked back across the field. This specific hunger hit him at an odd time. It almost came out of nowhere. When was the last time he had eaten? He thought back to eating breakfast back at his house, but that was only an hour and a half ago. We shouldn't be this hungry.

No matter. If his body was telling him that he was hungry, he was hungry. And so he needed to find food. He was sure that he would find food somewhere in the house. And he was sure that Mr. Johnson wouldn't mind at all if he took something.

Soon enough, he had made it back across the farm, and towards the back of the house. Robert looked on to see Bessie still there, chomping down on the grass she was grazing on. Robert smiled, thinking about how much Bessie must be enjoying herself. Robert passed by Bessie and paused to look her over.

"Enjoying yourself, Bessie?" Robert smiled.

Bessie didn't pay attention, as she grazed some more.

"You must be hungry too, huh?" Robert asked.

Now, Bessie looked up at him and mooed, before eating some more.

Robert looked at Bessie once again, but this time, couldn't help but to sense something was... weird. There was something off... Did Bessie seem skinnier? Before, Robert had looked at Bessie as a perfectly healthy cow. But now, she seemed like she was a little, tiny bit smaller in weight. Not too much. But a little bit.

"Well, that why you must be eating so much. You need to get some weight. I'll leave you be, girl." Robert said, as he walked away.

As he walked towards the house, he ignored the chill in his body. He couldn't really have noticed that his belly grew just a little bit. But it did.
15521121.title: Thinking about it on the way back

155211211.content:
Robert walked back into the house, closing the door on his way in. He found his way back to the kitchen, deciding to take a quick look through the cabinets and refrigerator. The house seemed to have everything a normal house would have, even some snacks and whatnot. However, despite the growling hunger in Robert's tummy, none of it seemed that appetizing.

"That's weird. I feel hungry as heck, and yet, none of this looks good. And I usually like chips and crackers." he groaned to himself.

This was hardly what he expected to happen on the first day. What was wrong with his stomach for him to feel so hungry, and yet so unhungry at the sight of normal food. The very thought frustrated him. Eventually, he put his shoes back on and decided to head back outside. Might as well clear his head while he was at it. For some reason, being inside the house just seemed to irritate him.

"You know, the sun feels really nice." he said, ignoring his hunger for a second. "Makes me want to stay outside all day. Heh, like that would ever happen."

He took another look at Bessie as he was passing by, and something else seemed to catch his eye briefly. Was it just him, or was Bessie getting closer to his size or something? Her belly seemed smaller, including her udder. That didn't exactly seem normal to him at all. He raised an eyebrow as he observed the cow. Her behavior didn't seem to change at all though.

"For some reason, this doesn't feel too odd, even though it's clearly odd. What is going on here?" he asked himself. He briefly looked down at the necklace he was wearing. It didn't look any different, but something felt off about it too.

Then, his stomach practically roared at him.

"Oooooohhhh, so hungry." he groaned, clutching his stomach as he fell down on the grass." As he fell, he didn't get a good look, but his belly got a tiny bit bigger, causing his bellybutton to be seen beneath his shirt.
155211211.title: Robert walks into the house, but can't find...

choices: Robert decides to eat some more, and gains a little more weight.
Robert decides to get up and follow Bessie into the house
1552112111.content:
Robert laid down on the cool, soft grass as his stomach growled once again. Robert didn't really feel pain at this point, but he did feel like he needed to get something in his stomach soon, just because his stomach just needed it.

"But what can I eat?" Robert cried out to no one in particular.

As he looked around, wondering where else he could find some food, his eyes slowly moved downward, starting to look at the ground. Or more specifically, he started to look at the grass. His eyes quickly locked onto the green grass sticking right up at his face.

All of a sudden, an urge came upon him. The first thought that came to his head was to just take a bite of the grass. To just grab it with his teeth and just chomp on it. That was weird, right? He shouldn't be having those thoughts as a rational human being, right?

And yet he couldn't get the thought out of his mind. He was hungry, and that grass looked a million times more appetizing than anything he had seen in the house. Robert struggled with it, but he couldn't help it anymore. His stomach was roaring again, and the grass just looked too good.

Robert lowered his face to the grass, opened his mouth, and took a big old bite out of the grass.

And he loved it.

He chewed on the grass for a moment, before swallowing it down, and taking another bite. As he took this bite, however, something caught his eye.

It was Bessie, who now seemed pretty small for a cow. So small, in fact, that she was now able to fit through the back door of the house, which she was now going inside.

Robert thought this was especially weird. And that he should do something. But he was still so hungry.
1552112111.title: Eyeing the grass

choices: Trying to make sense of it all
15521121111.content:
"Huh? What's she doing?" asked Robert, his mouth still full of grass from earlier. How in the world did Bessie get that small? There was no natural way that she could fit through the door into the house. That was totally bizarre.

Still, his mind kept going back to the grass. The taste felt pretty good in his mouth as a matter of fact. The texture seemed perfect and the taste was simple. His stomach seemed to accept it just fine as a matter of fact.

"Okay, eating grass is totally weird, but my stomach seems to like it." he muttered to himself.

He leaned back down and grabbed another mouthful of grass, chomping it in his mouth. He continued to chomp and chomp, almost getting into a bit of a routine with it. Still,his hunger never seemed to subside, as if it was hardly filling him up. With that in mind, he continued to chomp.

"You know, this is pretty good. Maybe I should tell Sarah about this sometime." he said, not realizing how odd it was for him to be pondering telling his younger sister about eating grass.

Anyway, back to the matter at hand, he eventually sat up on his legs, letting that batch of grass digest a bit. For some reason, it tasted better than any normal lunch he had, which was nice in a way. There was grass everywhere, so a diet of that would go forever. Still, the thought of eating just grass sounded strange to him, even as he stood up and tried to make sense of it.

However, as he did, he felt a little plompy on his belly. He looked down and gasped a bit as he did. His belly was sticking out of his shirt, his belly button fully exposed to the cool and crisp air. Not only that, when he put a hand to it, it looked a tiny bit pinkish to him, and the skin texture felt slightly different, as if it wasn't even skin anymore.

"What the heck is wrong with me belly?" he asked himself.

Robert thought this was especially weird. And that he should do something. But he was still so hungry. On the other hand, he couldn't let a cow loose in the house, even an inexplicably shrinking one.

He got up and followed Bessie into the house. He found her in the living room, as if she owned the place. The TV was on. He was certain it had been off before. "What the hell?" He muttered, his stomach still rumbling.

He tried to move her, but, despite the fact she was now a fourth of the size she'd been before, she wouldn't budge.

15531.content: Where did Jacob recently get hired?
15531.title: Jacob Smith (17)

155311.content: Jacob was recently hired by a local zoo, in order to train an unruly chimpanzee. This chimpanzee was meant to be sold to a circus, but it needed to be trained first. The chimp was fairly grizzled and hard to manage, however Jacob has trained numerous simians over the years. In his mind he knew this chimp would be no different, yet he was about to learn that wasn't the case at all. Jacob entered the zoo at 11:00 AM, and looked around for the woman he was supposed to meet there. As he stood next to the giraffe enclosure he heard someone approaching, he turned to see a knockout of a blonde standing right across from him. "You must be, Jacob!" Exclaimed the blonde, as she reached to shake Jake's hand. "You must be Talia! I've heard you've done a lot of research on chimpanzee behavior, and the like!" The blonde blushed and said, "It's not big a deal!" She said in a rather bashful tone, "There are plenty of women who know the inner working of a chimpanzee's mind. Yet, I have had no such break-through on Barney, our newest chimpanzee. Hopefully, you could train him! We were planning on selling the chimp to a nearby circus, that raises funds for charity!" Exclaimed the energetic blonde. "Leave it to me, I'm a master of getting into a monkey's mind! By the end of this, you won't be able to tell the chimp apart from me!" The woman laughed at Barney's boasts, as she lead him too...

1553111.content:
Jacob and Talia soon made their way through the zoo, passing the reptile house and the bear section, before finally making their way to the chimp enclosure. Jacob looked into the enclosure, seeing various chimpanzees doing what normal chimpanzees do, except for a single chimp sitting in the corner.

"I'm guessing that's Barney in the corner over there." Jacob said, as he pointed.

"Yeah. In all my years, I haven't seen a chimp act like Barney." Talia said, sighing.

"Oh, don't worry about that. I've had great experience with training chimps. Once we're through, he'll be the smartest chimp in the whole zoo." Jacob said.

"You're pretty young to be an expert on chimps." Talia inqiured.

"Yeah, well, I've always had a gift, you know. Fell in love at a young age, and never looked back." Jacob said.

Jacob smiled as he looked a Barney. He knew just from looking at him that it would be a challenge. But he wanted to take it. He would train this chimp, whether or not the chimp liked it.

"Well," Talia said, breaking Jacob out of his quiet trance, "let's go meet Barney."

Jacob follow Talia as she lead both of them to a building in the middle of the zoo. "These rooms are pretty big," Stated Talia, "Perfect for training Barney!" Talia lead Jacob and Barney into the room. "Here you go!" She exclaimed, "I'll leave you two alone!" Jake took a seat on a chair in the room, as Barney sat on the ground. "Time to get started Barney!" Exclaimed Jake, however the chimp just ignored him. Jake tried using sign language to appeal to the chimp, however the monkey just retorted with gestures. Jake was standing on his hands and knees, and try as he might, he couldn't get up from that position. And as he looked up, he was stunned to see Barney standing on his own two legs confidently. It wasn't necessarily weird for him to be standing on two legs. But for that long?

Suddenly, Barney let out a grin.

"It work." Barney said in a low gruff voice.

Jake was stunned.

"How can you... talk?" Jake said. Why was it a bit harder for him to think of the words?

Barney just let out a grunty laugh.

Exclaimed Barney in perfect English, "A chimpanzee grunts and shrieks, we'll have to work on that while training you." Barney walked over to Jacob, who backed up into a corner. "The first rule is obedience, now take off your shoes!" Jacob nervously took off his shoes, not wanting to upset the mystical monkey. "Very good, maybe dumb old monkeys can be taught new tricks!" Barney walked over to the chair that Jacob was previously sitting on. He made some throat clearing sounds, and began fidgeting slightly. "There we go!" Shouted Barney using Jacob's voice. "I got it! We can't teach you the proper tricks if you are not the right size yet. Chimps don't walk on their hands and knees!" Barney laughed.

It was an initially shocking sight when Amber came into view. The grown teenager was hunched over in front of mother kangaroo, smiling happily as the large marsupial lick through her hair. Her ears seemed to twitch as the mother's tongue swept over them, causing them to grow longer and folded. The seams of her shoes began to break as Amber's feet became narrow and larger. In fact, it seemed like her overall body size was shrinking as the kangaroo groomed and changed her.

Melissa began to panic, unsure as to what was happening with her daughter, but the feeling turned into confusion as her daughter's appearance and name seemed fuzzier and hard to remember by the second.

1553112111113112223212121212211211.content:
The longer Melissa stood there watching the two, the less she remembered about her daughter.

Amber's face clenched in stress before a loud *RIP* rang out, allowing her a sigh of relief. Behind her was the pair of jeans she had been wearing with a large kangaroo tail hanging out the large hole it had created. Amber swung it side to side playfully, giggling as if she had that tail her whole life. Several more rips echoed after the first as her feet ripped free from her shoes, her clawed toes wiggling happily at their newfound freedom.

Melissa looked at her daughter as memories of her began to fade. Soon, she was wondering why the kangaroo in front of her seemed familiar.

Amber looked up at the mother kangaroo, getting a face full of marsupial tongue which triggered her final transformation. Giving a happy chortle sound like her new mother, her face began to stretch out, bones creaking and shifting to adjust themselves with the change. The then stretching stopped, leaving Amber with a snout to match the one in front of her. She opened her eyes, revealing widened brown irises and pupils that made her eyes appear darker. Sniffing the air with her new nose, she approached the mother kangaroo's pouch, slipping into her sticky folds before happily popping her head outside.

Blinking a few times, Melissa came out of a daze as the last remnants of her Amber faded away, along with any evidence of her daughter's human past.

Talia walked up to her like nothing happened and began commenting about the new joey and her mother. "I see you've seen our newest joey, Amber! She took a real liking to this lonely mother kangaroo, and now it's like they've always been mother and daughter!"

Melissa could only rub her head a bit, unable to remember anything about that name. "Well, I guess that one has it easy, since it's been a kangaroo all her life."

Talia gave a sly smile as she stood next to her. "Oh I'm sure you'll do just fine! Maybe just as well as Amber's new mother!"

"What?" Melissa said. "She's a kangaroo."

"I am trying to use terms you can understand. She is going to continue evolving...and you...well, you are going in the other direction. It's an oversimplification, but it should explain it to you. Melissa's shoes shot across the ground as if out of a gun, as her newly gigantic feet exploded out of them. She caught a glimpse of her reflection.

She had long ears, hair that looked more like a pelt, a long tail that had hiked up her skirt, feet that would look big to a clown, and tiny hands.

"Maybe I should call you a kangaman, or a humanroo? No...too silly," Talia said.

155311211111311222321212121221211.content:
By the time they had reached the exhibit, the 16 year old Melissa had now become 10 years of age and the regression had slowed, but was still progressing.

Holding the regressing child's hand, Talia leads her into the kangaroo exhibit, closing the door behind them. The heat beamed down on the two, causing the younger Melissa to sweat a bit in the artificial sun of the outback.

Soon, Talia took her to a watering hole near the center of the exhibit where many of the kangaroos have congregated. She then lead her to one that was separate from the group: a mother kangaroo without a joey in its pouch, unlike the rest of the mob.

"This is Mary the kangaroo! She's been with us for quite a while and loves to always have fun with others. The problem is, she doesn't have a joey of her own." Talia explains.

"Aw! That's so sad! The pretty kangaroo has no joey?" Melissa asked more child-like.

"Unfortunately, yes, that's true. But our adoption program is meant to fix that, and that's where you come in," Talia tells her, turning to face Melissa with a warm smile. "Would you like to be this mother kangaroo's little joey?"

155311211111311222321212311211132311.content:
Amber's hair then started to become matted, growing around the outside of her face and reaching below her chin. Its color began to darken to the same color as the tuft of fur on the end of her tail. The new growth of fur finally drew her away from her tail, only to now have her pet and brush her hands through the thick mane.

The lion looked on proudly at her mane, appearing glorious in his eyes. Although she had grown a mane like his, he knew she would still become a beautiful lioness.

His attention was quickly drawn to her face at the sound of popping and low, contented growls flowing from her mouth.

Amber clutched onto her new mane, growling at the oddly sensual feeling of her face shifting. After a few boney pops and creaks, her mouth began to push out, only growing out partially, leaving her with a half-muzzle. Her nose had stretched to compensate for the change, becoming wider and leathery. Whiskers began to poke out, extending longer as new senses began to bombard her mind.

With the her final facial changes in place, she found it only natural to let out a loud, happy roar, empowering more of the lioness that was overtaking her human life.

Still with his eyes, Amber began to slowly walk towards the gate of the enclosure, her mind directed back and entranced once again on the male lion. She open the gate with ease, as the gate had been unlocked ahead of time, as if it were to be expected.

With a thud and a click, the door behind her closed and automatically locked, leaving her enthralled at the mercy of the lion. Yet Amber did not notice nor did she care about her changes as her lioness instincts began to rewrite her mind and memories.

15531121111131122232311332.content:
(Wanted to play this out a bit more slowly. Didn't seem to be any back story in the other version.)

Amber and her friends had come to the zoo to make fun of it, which was particularly disappointing as, years earlier, they had loved coming to the same zoo. But now they were teenagers and naturally dismissive of everything that didn't fit their conception of cool.

This went especially for Amber, Chloe, Madison, Brianna, and Kaitlyn...who seemed determined to live up to those stereotypes about mean, shallow, and pretty high school girls.

They had been going around the park all morning, taking pictures of each other as well as selfies with animals in the background...posting them online with occasionally amusing commentary.

"This is what could happen if you don't moisturize," Madison said, looking at the elephants in their habitat. "Grey wrinkly skin....yuck."

Talia had been tailing the girls after overhearing them, taking note of their criticisms. She would take care of them like she took care of Jacob. The world would be a better place when she fixed it and the 'right' creatures were behind bars.
15531121111131122232311332.title: Something else

choices: Elephants and Lions and Lame...oh my
155311211111311222323113322.content:
They moved on to the lion habitat. Amber looked down at the sole lion in view. "His hair looks like pictures of my Mom from when she was in high school." The other girls giggled. "He'd look pretty decent if he got a stylist."

"This is so lame..." Kaitlyn commented.

Talia perked up. A dissenter in the group?

"They are just a bunch of stupid animals. Why don't we just go to the mall or something?" She asked.

Talia shrugged. So much for the next generation.
155311211111311222323113322.title: The teens move on to make fun of something else

"Shut up, bird brain..."

Feeling curious about her surroundings, Kaitlyn quickly forgets about the door locking her in and begins wandering around the caged forest. Looking around, it appeared to be a typical bird house, until she came across other people, though these people looked more like exotic bird people if anything. Many were in various stages of changes, with one woman attempting to fly to a branch with her fellow falcons and a man who gave a loud squawk as the back of his pants burst, revealing a colorful array of peacock feathers.

As she walked around, her legs began to behave differently as she began to lift them up closer to her upper body with every step like a parrot would do. Her head seemed to dart from one place to another at inhumanly fast speeds as she tried to comprehend all the sights and sounds of birds and bird people. She even pulled her wrists near her armpits instinctual way to fold them like wings.

The habitat itself seemed to never end, as when she walked further into the building, the bigger the forest gets. Whenever she would see another person, she could only reply in human sounding squawks and repeating the last thing she said, "Make me...aRRRAWWWWK"

Though she didn't noticed, it was clear her mind was becoming bird-brained like the rest of the guests turned bird people here. She didn't mind though, it felt right to be there and act like that.

choices: June teaches at an elementary school

1553221.content:
June arrived in the parking lot with a bit smile on her face. She had just gotten a new teaching job, her first in a long, long time. She smiled and breathed a bit breath of relief as she stepped out of her car.

"OK, June. Today is going to change a lot of people's lives. Let's do this." June said to herself.

June walked into the building, and towards the principal's office. June should make a good first impression, so why not do that by meeting her boss on her first day of work?
1553221.title: History Teacher

15532211.content:
She had trained as a history teacher, but was finding it hard to get a job, so she'd taken a job as an elementary school teacher. She'd gotten certified in both in school...trying to have a fallback.

What grade is June teaching?

155322112.content: Does June teach First Grade?
155322112.title: Younger maybe?

1553221121.content: The principal, Mrs. Archibald, took her to the first grade class she'd been teaching. "We're glad we could get you on such short notice. Ms. Lane, the last teacher...resigned all of the sudden. I believe she met someone...you know how it is nowadays. It's a hard job and sometimes it isn't for everyone. It was her first job after all."
1553221121.title: The first graders

15532211211.content:
"Well, I wish you all the luck in the world, Miss. Samson. I hope you change these kids, and I hope these kids change you." said Mrs. Archibald.

"I'll certainly try." said June, as she entered the class.

"Good morning, everyone. My name is Miss Samson, and I'll be your new teacher for the rest of the year! Isn't that exciting!" June said, as she looked over the large class of first graders.
